page.title: 02Farming Around Shepley.
page.content: Field Head Farm Mr. & Mrs. Matthews have farmed at Field Head Farm on the edge of Shepley village for twelve years. The farm covers one hundred and eight acres and except for a few fields of barley grain for winter feed, the land is cultivated for grazing. We found most of the land around here was used for pasture land. We visited them in June when they had finished their first cutting of grass for winter sileage. They hope to cut three times a year. There were one hundred and twenty three cows on the farm, mainly dairy breeds but a few beef. Many farmers around Shepley bottle and sell their own milk but Mr. Matthews sells his to the Milk Marketing Board. It is then taken to a big local creamery where it is made into yogurt and cottage cheese.
